Arrow — Shownotes S01E01

By:
Mailed on: October 24, 2012

Dear , ,

Dear Cast and Crew of Arrow, S1E01 – “Pilot” 

Original air date: October 10, 2012

Synopsis:
In this episode, Jack wakes up on the beach after Oceanic Flight 815 crashes into a mysterious island that…no, wait. Sorry. In this episode, Oliver Queen returns to Starling City after being shipwrecked for five years. He uses his newfound survivalist skills to fight crime. With a bow and arrow. Obviously.

Shownotes:

  • Cold open: forest running! You’re really paying off on your elevator pitch, “It’s the fourth season of Lost, but with more bows and arrows.” (JY)
  • Three minutes in and I’m already missing Stephen Amell’s beard from the cold open. (CR)
  • Terrific headline: “Lost Billionaire Found!” (JY)
  • Starling City? Changing the name of Star City makes no sense, but I’ll let it pass. (JY)
  • “Laurel” Lance? No. No. I can’t let this one pass.  (JY)
  • Cocky billionaire playboy who fights crime alongside unflappable love interest and loyal chauffeur? Please update elevator pitch to read: “It’s the fourth season of Lost, starring Tony Stark, with bows and arrows.” (JY)
  • Rooftop parkour chase! Machine gunnery! This entire sequence is…surprisingly well-done for an hour-long network TV drama. Almost too well-done. Please save some production budget for later episodes to avoid an inevitable decline. (JY)
  • “Nobody can know my secret!” Did he just break that guy’s neck? (JY)
  • No lame tranquilizer darts instead of arrows—he actually kills people! This show has a fighting chance. (CR)
  • “A Queen’s ransom, as it were!” I see what you did there. Because his name is Oliver Queen. So you switched the words. (wink*) (JY)
  • Steven Amell’s stubble: consistently rugged and sexy throughout. Props to makeup department. (JY)
  • Steven Amell’s secret warehouse: pretty generic. Who ships with wooden crates anymore? We need to make up for the props department. (JY)
  • Cast Away D.O.P. Don Burgess deserves a royalty check for that shot where Oliver’s girlfriend gets sucked out to sea. (CR)
  • Police sketch clearly drawn by famed Green Arrow artist Mike Grell. I think. Mike Grell is still alive, right? (JY)
  • Wait. Lives in chateau-style mansion. Dank hideout with tech-nerd workspace surrounded in computer displays? Please update elevator pitch to read: “It’s the fourth season of Lost, starring Bruce Wayne, with bows and arrows.” (JY)
  • Training montage! You’re hitting the right notes, here. Almost making up for the pointless renaming of Star City (but not quite). (JY)
  • Oliver is somehow (still?) a cyber wiz 5 years after living like a caveman?
  • Villain cowering in the back seat of a car, listening to the whoops and whooshes of his henchmen being taken out before being pulled unceremoniously out the window to cower beneath our crouching hero? Totally original! (JY)
  • (Please amend title of this episode to: “Arrow Begins”.) (JY)
  • (Please add Christopher Nolan’s name to directing credits.) (JY)
  • Seriously, though. I’m impressed by the fight choreography. (JY)

As disappointed as I am with what you’ve done with the Green Arrow canon (Laurel? Laurel!? She’s not a hippie aunt, she’s Mockingbird!), I suppose I’m convinced enough by your quality portrayal of the ultra-violence that I will be back next week. (JY)

Signed,

Jared Young

Christopher Redmond

Status: (/5)

Eddie: The Sleepwalking Cannibal | Nashville — Shownotes S01E03
